result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel A Revolorio Martinez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JAs Response to 2/28/17 RUMS
Court orders that the $150 CASH bond should be applied to court ordered costs.
Clerk's Note regarding bond
Criminal Case Settlement and Elements

Cases 15CM517, 16CF35 and 15CM363 called together at 2:12pm [ma]
Defendant Manuel A Revolorio Martinez in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Fayme Filipiak sworn as Spanish Interpreter 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM517(Amended Complaint) and Count #1 of Case 16CF35; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2 and #3 of Case 16CF35 and Case 15CM363 as to this Defendant

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 of Case 15CM517, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30  days in Jefferson County Jail; to commence FORTHWITH
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

On Count #2 of Case 15CM517, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30  days in Jefferson County Jail, consecutive to the sentence in Count #1 of 15CM517
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

On Count #1 of Case 16CF35, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 179 days in Jefferson County Jail, consecutive to sentence in Counts #1 and #2 of 15CM517,
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge= $518

Days Credit: 178 days apportioned as to each case in order of sentence

The total costs/fees of Cases 15CM517 and 16CF35 is to be paid in $150 per month installments commencing on 4/13/17 and on the 13th day of each month thereafter until paid in full

As to Case 15CM517 Count #1: non-payment shall result in a 8  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
As to Case 15CM517 Count #2: non-payment shall result in a 8  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
As to Case 16CF35 Count #1: non-payment shall result in a 10  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

[NOTE: Individual amounts were announced on record; but grand total of all cases was NOT]

Cases 15CM517,16CF35,15CM363 called together at 10:38am [MA]
Defendant Manuel A Revolorio Martinez in court, in custody with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski remains under oath as Spanish Interpreter
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Dahnert requests an adjournment due to a newly referred case.
The Court denies this request and schedules all cases for JT.

Atty. Dahnert indicates that there are no witnesses that need the assistance of a spanish interpreter
The Court requires 2 interpreters for Trial

The Court distributes its scheduling order.

[MK] cases #15CM363, #15CM517, #16CF35 called at 4:08pm
Defendant Manuel A Revolorio Martinez in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie H Dahnert.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance in Case #15CM517 and in #16CF35.
Attorney Dahnert requests the scheduling of another status conference, indicating that there are new developments involving Mr. Revolorio Martinez that she would like to present to the prosecutor as part of plea-negotiations. 
The Court grants the scheduling request. 
recess 4:11pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference on all three cases on 11/29/16 at 10:00am
Status conference on September 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2016 at 08:20 am.

Cases 15CM363, 15CM517, 16CF35 called together at 8:58am [MA]
Defendant Manuel A Revolorio Martinez in court, in custody with attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter

ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance in all cases.

As to Case 16CF35, Preliminary Hearing occurs:
Deputy Peter Betanski -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Beck
--cross examination by Attorney Dahnert

Evidence closed at: 9:12am

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Martinez committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

recess: 9:13am--reconvene: 9:19am

As to Case 16CF35, Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--demand for speedy trial

Trial dates will not be set today, pending the status conference date already scheduled; if resolution is not met on/before the status conference date, a trial will be scheduled at the status conference with speedy demand requested on this date( 8/29/16)
Clerk announces next hearing dates as to all cases
recess: 9:21am 

NEXT: As to All Cases:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/7/16 at 8:20am  (2) Status Conference on 9/27/16 at 3:30pm
Attorney Sylvie Dahnert
Status conference on August 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bond to cover 15CM363 & 15CM517

Cases 15CM363, 15CM517 & 16CF35 called at 2:20 pm [sf]
Defendant Manuel A Revolorio Martinez in custody with Attorney ELizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Susan Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Shawna Stevenoski sworn in as Spanish Interpreter.
Court reviews procedural posture of the cases.

On 16CF35:
Defendant advises that his DOB is 7/5/1983. 
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant will be residing with friends in Fort Atkinson but does not know the address.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

On case 16CF35, the Court requires $150.00 CASH signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-Maintain absolute sobriety

On cases 15CM363 & 15CM517 the Court requires an additional $150 CASH to cover both files with previous non-monetary conditions
Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit.

Recess: 2:27 pm
NEXT: (1)16CF35 Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 8/29/16 at 8:30 am - send notices  (2) 15CM363 & 15CM517Status Conference scheduled for 8/29/16 at 8:30 am  - send notices

Case called at 1:01pm {mo]
[Scheduled for Status Conference]
Defendant Manuel A Revolirio Martinez does NOT appear in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record; including the already issued bench warrant

ADA Hall orally motions to correct the spelling of the Defendant's last name within the Criminal Complaint to R-E-V-O-L-O-R-I-O, notes the latter portion of his name is spelled correctly.
--the Court grants this notion

The Court issues a new warrant with the correct spelling of the Defendant's last name
The Court notes the warrant with the incorrectly spelled last name should remain in effect, until the Court authorizes the new warrant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.

[MK] Cases #15CM361 and #15CM363 called at 11:29am. 
Co- Defendant Javier U Barrientos Martinez in court.
Co-Defendant Manuel A. Revolirio Martinez in court.
ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter for Manuel Revolirio Martinez.
Both Defendants verify that the dates of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given. The Court refers the Co-Defendants to the PD Office; they should go there today to apply for representation. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered and speedy trial waived by the Court on behalf of both Co-Defendants.
The Court continues the $150 Cash Bonds already posted by each Co-Defendant.  
recess 11:39am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 11:00 (for #15CM361) and 3:00pm (for #15M363),   (2) Status Conference on 12/8/15 at 10:30am.
